description: The Eiffel Tower is a world-famous iron lattice monument located in Paris, France. Constructed in 1889, it stands as an iconic symbol of both Paris and France.
The Taj Mahal is an architectural marvel situated in Agra, India. Built in the 17th century by Emperor Shah Jahan, it is a white marble mausoleum and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Machu Picchu is an ancient Incan city nestled in the Andes mountains of Peru. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape.
The Great Wall of China is a historic fortification stretching across northern China. Built to protect against invasions, it spans thousands of miles and is a testament to ancient engineering.
